title: Ticket #2487: Multiple claims: enable multiple claims in startd and schedd
description:
Milestone 1 (due 20110926):

The goal of this milestone is to get the basic plumbing for the multiple claim work in place. After completion, everything in Condor should still work as it used to. Essential changes include:

  • Extend Startd (and -client) side to support super- and subclaims.
  • Change API to forward claim-specific functions to all subclaims

State: code complete but requires more testing and definitely code review (because this ticket is a work-in-progress ticket, I will create a separate code review ticket for Zach)

Milestone 2 (due 20111017):

The goal of this milestone is to enable async file transfer by creating a subclaim for the output file transfer itself.

After the first round of reviews, the following items need to be addressed:

  • Remove cloned functions (obviously)
  • Replace ReliSock in new DCSchedd function called from Shadow to inform about started file transfer
  • Have only the parent claim send keep alives (inherit from children)
  • Add boolean value into match record to indicate active/inactive claim/subclaim. Down the road, the match record should also know about resources used such that schedd can make scheduling decisions within claim
  • Make sure that startd state is appropriately advertised to negotiator (i.e. only take into account state changes induced by parent claim)
  • Investigate carefully that parent claim can never time out before a subclaim
  • Add config knob that turns on async file transfer and keep a code path in place that supports old claiming protocol such that async transfer can be tested but will not be imposed right away
remarks: Currently in review, schedd is solid now, startd side is now back to improvements since I rolled back to an earlier version of the claim object.
